reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told that the Chau Pho was one of the two best hotels in Chau Doc, with the Victoria being the best. However, we were not at all impressed. Although our room was very large, with a three piece suite and lots of space, there were few other positives. The room had a strange musty smell which suggested dampness, although there was none evident. The bed was the least comfortable we had on our tour of SE Asia, and the light shining on the hotel sign on the wall outside made our room like daylight even with the curtains drawn. There were also intermittent strange noises through the night that we never identified. So we had a poor night's sleep. There were no public lounge areas to sit in and the whole place had a very downmarket feel to it. It is located in a backstreet that has no other tourist related venues, and the pavements were in very poor condition so walking was uncomfortable. In the end we gave up looking for a restaurant and ate in the hotel, which was of a reasonable standard although the room lacked any character and was largely filled with tour groups. Overall it is just about acceptable for an overnight stop but not a hotel to spend any time in.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Hotel is right at the market square and the noise carries over. Rooms are comfortable. Good breakfast choices. We could watch live on the streets from our room, including a funeral procession with noisy music. Good choice for a central location.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: AS border towns go it wasn't bad but we certainly didn't have one of the large rooms with sofa's or sitting rooms. We switched off the a/c but couldn't open the window because of the noise from the karaoke bar across the road. The temperature in the hotel restaurant was too cold for us to eat there even with coats on, we tried, but then took our drinks up to our room to defrost. The biggest problem was that the hotel was full of tour groups all leaving at the same time so it was impossible to get the suitcases down in the lift! That wasn't pleasant.
reviews.title: Very cold restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We eventually ate at a local place down the road and the food was good but the noise level there was such that it wasn't condusive to conversation. We ended up at the bar closest to the hotel which was quiet and drank as much alcohol as possible with a view to managing to sleep through the karaoke.
reviews.title: Good hotel in an Border Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very large with a sofa and 2 chairs plus a nice bathroom. The lighting was good but the bed was the harder Asian style. Breakfast was quite good with plenty of variety. The drawback was the location as it is across the street from a karoke place which had a booming bass which became annoying.
reviews.title: not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the end of a Mekong bicycle tour, didn't expect much and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were huge, including a large sitting room, clean, had comfortable beds and large washrooms. Wifi was free, with a password from the front desk. The neighbourhood was not good for walking, with breaks in the sidewalks and an odd mix of businesses. Enough restaurants to find a meal, and the hotel dining was OK.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a tenniscourt in the back Chau Pho has a future with its clean and fresh rooms. Showerpower could be improved, breakfast was not upon par but hey, don't we all need something to improve sometimes? Staff has been efficient, there's plenty of restaurants around serving OK food and cold beers.
reviews.title: Quite new, quite OK
Clean and promising, but some let downs
reviews.text: We were amazed by the size of our room when we walked in. Massive is the only way it could be described for a hotel of this standard. The shower was also impressive with modern facilities - a great way to relax and cool down after a long day. The bed unfortunately was very hard and the pillows too high for my liking. No other options were available. We were disappointed by the breakfast, particularly after reading other reviews. A large tour group looked to be departing the hotel as we arrived for breakfast and there was not much on offer. All the bread was gone. Despite a number of staff wandering around and cleaning up, 15 minutes later there was still no bread available to the many guests who had, like us, arrived. We opted for an omelet and rated it as the worst we have ever had. The juice tasted as though it was a powdered mix. Both of us felt quite squirmish after and wondered if it was as a result of something at breakfast ...

reviews.title: Average hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at Chau Pho hotel for one night whilst on tour from Cambodia to Saigon. Rooms were clean and restaurant was fine.
The hotel is an average 3 star and is ok to stay in but be prepared for the doof doof music from over the road that can keep you awake.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: I spent 1 night at the hotel with a friend. Rooms were nice with lots of space and clean. Bathroom was good too, except for the shower. We were on the 5th floor and the shiwer did not have any power at all which made showering very difficult and lengthy.
reviews.title: good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurant was good too with a wide choice for breakfast, Western as well as Asian things to choose from and try out.
reviews.title: New and Clean Hotel in a Small town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a little walk from the promenade though.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay before heading to Cambodia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and nice and neat compared to the city, which is very polluted and conjusted. The restaurant is good and serves free breakfast in the morning. The rooms are big, clean and have a mini bar and safe.
reviews.title: Nice place to visit but...
Sufficient if we consider the location
reviews.text: The area around is not safe at night for people who want to walk out alone at night, we had few people following us when we went out to eat walking so immideatly we got in to a cab. So don't wander around alone at night.

Arrived in Chau Doc after a 5 hour trip by bumpy speed boat and this hotel was a little oasis. The most lovely rooms - large, beautifully decorated. We were worried because there was a large and occasionally noisy karaoke place across the road, but we never heard a thing. Wonderful dinner in the restaurant - very friendly and helpful staff. Only problem was some leakage from the shower onto the bathroom floor - no real problem.
reviews.title: Wonderful at the end of a long day

reviews.text: We arrived here in the evening before an early morning boat up the Mekong, so had little time to really make the most of the hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient for the ferry, spacious rooms

reviews.text: The room was spacious, the beds comfortable and the bathroom fairly standard. The receptionist was very pleasant on the check-in desk and happily booked our boat for us (despite it being late in the evening and the boat early the next morning). She was very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was okay - a buffet combining continental staples likes breads and cereals with eastern treats. There were also options to have eggs. The juice (like many places in Vietnam) was really just sugary water - and there were some tiny ants/flies on the table which were a little distracting. However, again staff were very nice.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: I imagine good for a short stay, there's not much in the town anyway - apart from some nice cafes and a market.
reviews.title: Overnight stay
